Judul: US astronomers face hard decisions astronomers face hard decisions
Abstrak:
Every ten years, US astronomers set research priorities for the following decade. The latest cycle to pick projects for the 2020s has just started. In July, the US National Academy of Sciences launched
the seventh Astronomical Decadal Survey (Astro2020) with a call for proposals for future telescopes and space missions. Over the coming year, these will be collected, assessed and discussed in open meetings.
A ranked list of priority projects will be released in 2021. Funding permitting, those at the top will be built over the next decades.
Fakultas: Fakultas Matematika dan Ilmu Pengetahuan Alam
